identificationModule.briefTitle: Effect of Intensive Language Therapy in Subacute Stroke Patients
identificationModule.officialTitle: Effect of Intensive Language Therapy in Subacute Stroke Patients

descriptionModule.briefSummary: Early stroke rehabilitation is known to be an effective and essential therapy in gaining functional independence and preventing complications. However, there was no consensus of proper amount of language rehabilitation in stroke patients. In this study, the investigators investigated the effects of the intensive language rehabilitation during subacute phase to improve language function in patients with first-ever strokes.
descriptionModule.detailedDescription:
Intensive language rehabilitation group - language rehabilitation therapy by language therapist for 1 hours on every working day for 4 weeks

Conventional language rehabilitation group

- language rehabilitation therapy by language therapist for 30 minutes on every working day for 4 weeks

armGroups.description: language rehabilitation therapy by language therapist for 1 hours on every working day for 4 weeks

armGroups.description: language rehabilitation therapy by language therapist for 30 minutes on every working day for 4 weeks

interventions.name: language rehabilitation therapy
interventions.description: language therapy is language rehabilitation by language therapist during subacute phase in stroke patients

primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Change of Korean version- Western Aphasia Battery after language rehabilitation for 4 weeks

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Acute first-ever stroke
* Left hemispheric stroke
* Korean version of Frenchay Aphasia Screening Test(K-FAST) \< 25 (less than 65 years old), K-FAST \<20 (65 years old and more than 65 years old) at 7 days after stroke onset
* Right handedness

Exclusion Criteria:

* Transient ischemic stroke
